keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The report, by an international investigative firm, said some subcontractors employed at the university’s Abu Dhabi campus were exempted from N.Y.U. guidelines based on decisions by local contractors.

headline.print_headline: N.Y.U. Labor Guidelines Failed to Protect 10,000 Workers in Abu Dhabi, Report Says
headline.main: N.Y.U. Labor Guidelines Failed to Protect 10,000 Workers in Abu Dhabi, Report Says

snippet: The report, by an international investigative firm, said some subcontractors employed at the university’s Abu Dhabi campus were exempted from N.Y.U. guidelines based on decisions by local contractors.
abstract: Investigative report finds that about one-third, or 10,000, migrant construction workers at site of New York University extension campus in Abu Dhabi were excluded from university's labor protection guidelines; concludes that most workers were treated in accordance with university guidelines, but that local contractors chose to exempt some.
